00052 fsal_status_t FSAL_create(
00053     fsal_handle_t         * p_parent_directory_handle, /* IN */
00054     fsal_name_t           * p_filename,              /* IN */
00055     fsal_op_context_t     * p_context,              /* IN */
00056     fsal_accessmode_t       accessmode,                /* IN */
00057     fsal_handle_t         * p_object_handle,           /* OUT */
00058     fsal_attrib_list_t    * p_object_attributes        /* [ IN/OUT ] */
00059 ){
00060   
00061   int rc, fd, errsv;
00062   int setgid_bit = 0;
00063   fsal_status_t status;
00064   
00065   fsal_path_t   fsalpath;
00066   struct stat buffstat;
00067   fsal_posixdb_fileinfo_t info;
00068   mode_t  unix_mode;
00069   
00070   /* sanity checks.
00071    * note : object_attributes is optional.
00072    */
00073   if ( !p_parent_directory_handle || 
00074        !p_context ||
00075        !p_object_handle ||
00076        !p_filename )
00077     Return(ERR_FSAL_FAULT ,0 , INDEX_FSAL_create);
00078   
00079   /* convert fsal mode to unix mode. */
00080   unix_mode = fsal2unix_mode( accessmode );
00081   
00082   /* Apply umask */
00083   unix_mode = unix_mode & ~global_fs_info.umask ;
00084   
00085   
00086 #ifdef _DEBUG_FSAL
00087   DisplayLogJdLevel( fsal_log, NIV_FULL_DEBUG, "Creation mode: 0%o", accessmode ) ;
00088 #endif
00089   
00090   /* build the destination path */
00091   status = fsal_internal_getPathFromHandle(p_context, p_parent_directory_handle, 1, &fsalpath, &buffstat);
00092   if (FSAL_IS_ERROR(status)) Return(status.major, status.minor, INDEX_FSAL_create);
00093 
00094   /* Check the user can write in the directory, and check the setgid bit on the directory */
00095   if (buffstat.st_mode & S_ISGID) setgid_bit = 1;
00096 
00097   status = fsal_internal_testAccess( p_context, FSAL_W_OK | FSAL_X_OK, &buffstat, NULL);
00098   if (FSAL_IS_ERROR(status)) Return(status.major,status.minor,INDEX_FSAL_create);
00099   
00100   
00101   status = fsal_internal_appendFSALNameToFSALPath(&fsalpath, p_filename);
00102   if (FSAL_IS_ERROR(status)) Return(status.major, status.minor, INDEX_FSAL_create);
00103   
00104   /* call to API */
00105   
00106   TakeTokenFSCall();
00107   /* create the file */
00108   fd = open(fsalpath.path, O_CREAT|O_WRONLY|O_TRUNC|O_EXCL, unix_mode); /* error if the file already exists */
00109   errsv = errno;
00110   if (fd == -1) goto releaseToken;
00111   /* close the file descriptor */
00112   rc = close(fd);
00113   errsv = errno;
00114   if (rc) goto releaseToken;
00115   /* stat the new file */
00116   rc = lstat(fsalpath.path, &buffstat);
00117   errsv=errno;
00118   
00119 releaseToken:
00120   ReleaseTokenFSCall();
00121 
00122   if (fd == -1 || rc) Return(posix2fsal_error(errsv), errsv, INDEX_FSAL_create);
00123 
00124   /* add the file to the database */
00125   if (FSAL_IS_ERROR( status = fsal_internal_posix2posixdb_fileinfo(&buffstat, &info) ) )
00126     Return( status.major, status.minor, INDEX_FSAL_create);
00127   if (FSAL_IS_ERROR (status = fsal_internal_posixdb_add_entry( p_context->p_conn, p_filename, &info, p_parent_directory_handle, p_object_handle)))
00128     Return( status.major, status.minor, INDEX_FSAL_create);
00129   
00130   /* the file has been created */
00131   /* chown the file to the current user */
00132 
00133   if (p_context->credential.user != geteuid()) {
00134     TakeTokenFSCall();
00135     /* if the setgid_bit was set on the parent directory, do not change the group of the created file, because it's already the parentdir's group */
00136     rc = lchown( fsalpath.path, p_context->credential.user, setgid_bit ? -1 : (int) p_context->credential.group );
00137     errsv = errno;
00138     ReleaseTokenFSCall();
00139     if ( rc ) Return(posix2fsal_error(errsv), errsv, INDEX_FSAL_create);
00140     
00141     buffstat.st_uid = p_context->credential.user;
00142     buffstat.st_gid = p_context->credential.group;
00143   }
00144   
00145   /* add the file to the database */
00146   
00147   if ( p_object_attributes ) {
00148       
00149     
00150       /* convert POSIX attributes to fsal attributes */
00151       status=posix2fsal_attributes( &buffstat,
00152                                    p_object_attributes );
00153       /* on error, we set a special bit in the mask. */        
00154       if ( FSAL_IS_ERROR( status ) )
00155       {
00156         FSAL_CLEAR_MASK( p_object_attributes->asked_attributes );
00157         FSAL_SET_MASK( p_object_attributes->asked_attributes,
00158             FSAL_ATTR_RDATTR_ERR );
00159       }
00160         
00161   }
00162     
00163   
00164   /* OK */
00165   Return(ERR_FSAL_NO_ERROR ,0 , INDEX_FSAL_create);
00166   
00167 }

00201 fsal_status_t FSAL_mkdir(
00202     fsal_handle_t         * p_parent_directory_handle, /* IN */
00203     fsal_name_t           * p_dirname,             /* IN */
00204     fsal_op_context_t     * p_context,              /* IN */
00205     fsal_accessmode_t     accessmode,          /* IN */
00206     fsal_handle_t         * p_object_handle,           /* OUT */
00207     fsal_attrib_list_t    * p_object_attributes   /* [ IN/OUT ] */
00208 ){
00209 
00210   int rc, errsv;
00211   int setgid_bit = 0;
00212   struct stat buffstat;
00213   mode_t  unix_mode;
00214   fsal_status_t status;
00215   fsal_path_t fsalpath;
00216   fsal_posixdb_fileinfo_t info;
00217   
00218   /* sanity checks.
00219    * note : object_attributes is optional.
00220    */
00221   if ( !p_parent_directory_handle || 
00222        !p_context ||
00223        !p_object_handle ||
00224        !p_dirname)
00225     Return(ERR_FSAL_FAULT ,0 , INDEX_FSAL_mkdir);
00226 
00227     
00228   /* convert FSAL mode to HPSS mode. */
00229   unix_mode = fsal2unix_mode( accessmode );
00230 
00231   /* Apply umask */
00232   unix_mode = unix_mode & ~global_fs_info.umask ;
00233 
00234   /* build the destination path */
00235   status = fsal_internal_getPathFromHandle(p_context, p_parent_directory_handle, 1, &fsalpath, &buffstat);
00236   if (FSAL_IS_ERROR(status)) Return(status.major, status.minor, INDEX_FSAL_mkdir);
00237   
00238   /* Check the user can write in the directory, and check the setgid bit on the directory */
00239   if (buffstat.st_mode & S_ISGID) setgid_bit = 1;
00240 
00241   status = fsal_internal_testAccess( p_context, FSAL_W_OK | FSAL_X_OK, &buffstat, NULL);
00242   if (FSAL_IS_ERROR(status)) Return(status.major,status.minor,INDEX_FSAL_mkdir);
00243   
00244   status = fsal_internal_appendFSALNameToFSALPath(&fsalpath, p_dirname);
00245   if (FSAL_IS_ERROR(status)) Return(status.major, status.minor, INDEX_FSAL_mkdir);
00246     
00247   /* creates the directory and stats it */
00248   TakeTokenFSCall();
00249   
00250   rc = mkdir(fsalpath.path, unix_mode);
00251   if (!rc) rc = lstat(fsalpath.path, &buffstat);
00252   errsv = errno;
00253   
00254   ReleaseTokenFSCall();
00255   
00256   if ( rc ) Return(posix2fsal_error(errsv), errsv, INDEX_FSAL_mkdir);
00257     
00258 
00259   /* add the directory to the database */
00260   if (FSAL_IS_ERROR( status = fsal_internal_posix2posixdb_fileinfo(&buffstat, &info) ) )
00261     Return( status.major, status.minor, INDEX_FSAL_mkdir);
00262   if (FSAL_IS_ERROR (status = fsal_internal_posixdb_add_entry( p_context->p_conn, p_dirname, &info, p_parent_directory_handle, p_object_handle)))
00263     Return( status.major, status.minor, INDEX_FSAL_mkdir);
00264   
00265   /* the directory has been created */
00266   /* chown the file to the current user/group */
00267 
00268   if (p_context->credential.user != geteuid()) {
00269     TakeTokenFSCall();
00270     /* if the setgid_bit was set on the parent directory, do not change the group of the created file, because it's already the parentdir's group */
00271     rc = lchown( fsalpath.path, p_context->credential.user, setgid_bit ? -1 : (int) p_context->credential.group );
00272     errsv = errno;
00273     ReleaseTokenFSCall();
00274     if ( rc ) Return(posix2fsal_error(errsv), errsv, INDEX_FSAL_mkdir);
00275     
00276     buffstat.st_uid = p_context->credential.user;
00277     buffstat.st_gid = p_context->credential.group;
00278   }
00279   
00280   /* Fills the attributes if needed */
00281   if ( p_object_attributes ) {
00282       
00283       status = posix2fsal_attributes( &buffstat,
00284                                    p_object_attributes );
00285       
00286       /* on error, we set a special bit in the mask. */        
00287             
00288       if ( FSAL_IS_ERROR( status ) )
00289       {
00290         FSAL_CLEAR_MASK( p_object_attributes->asked_attributes );
00291         FSAL_SET_MASK( p_object_attributes->asked_attributes,
00292             FSAL_ATTR_RDATTR_ERR );
00293       }
00294             
00295   }
00296   
00297   /* OK */
00298   Return(ERR_FSAL_NO_ERROR ,0 , INDEX_FSAL_mkdir);
00299   
00300 }

00334 fsal_status_t FSAL_link(
00335     fsal_handle_t         * p_target_handle,        /* IN */
00336     fsal_handle_t         * p_dir_handle,           /* IN */
00337     fsal_name_t           * p_link_name,          /* IN */
00338     fsal_op_context_t     * p_context,              /* IN */
00339     fsal_attrib_list_t    * p_attributes       /* [ IN/OUT ] */
00340 ){
00341   
00342   int rc, errsv;
00343   fsal_status_t status;
00344   fsal_path_t fsalpath_old, fsalpath_new;
00345   fsal_posixdb_fileinfo_t info;
00346   fsal_handle_t newhandle;
00347   struct stat buffstat, buffstat_dir;
00348   
00349   /* sanity checks.
00350    * note : attributes is optional.
00351    */
00352   if ( !p_target_handle || 
00353        !p_dir_handle || 
00354        !p_context || 
00355        !p_link_name)
00356     Return(ERR_FSAL_FAULT ,0 , INDEX_FSAL_link);
00357   
00358   
00359   /* Tests if hardlinking is allowed by configuration. */
00360   
00361   if ( !global_fs_info.link_support )
00362       Return( ERR_FSAL_NOTSUPP, 0,INDEX_FSAL_link);
00363   
00364 #ifdef _DEBUG_FSAL    
00365   fprintf(stderr, "linking %llu/%i to %llu.%i/%s \n", p_target_handle->id, p_target_handle->ts, p_dir_handle->id, p_dir_handle->ts, p_link_name->name);
00366 #endif
00367     
00368   /* get the old path */
00369   status = fsal_internal_getPathFromHandle(p_context, p_target_handle, 0, &fsalpath_old, &buffstat);
00370   if (FSAL_IS_ERROR(status)) {
00371     Return(status.major, status.minor, INDEX_FSAL_link);
00372   }
00373   
00374   /* build the destination path and check permissions on the directory */
00375   status = fsal_internal_getPathFromHandle(p_context, p_dir_handle, 1, &fsalpath_new, &buffstat_dir);
00376   if (FSAL_IS_ERROR(status)) Return(status.major, status.minor, INDEX_FSAL_link);
00377   
00378   status = fsal_internal_testAccess( p_context, FSAL_W_OK | FSAL_X_OK, &buffstat_dir, NULL);
00379   if (FSAL_IS_ERROR(status)) Return(status.major,status.minor,INDEX_FSAL_link);
00380   
00381   status = fsal_internal_appendFSALNameToFSALPath(&fsalpath_new, p_link_name);
00382   if (FSAL_IS_ERROR(status)) Return(status.major, status.minor, INDEX_FSAL_link);
00383   
00384   /* Create the link on the filesystem */
00385   
00386   TakeTokenFSCall();
00387   rc = link(fsalpath_old.path, fsalpath_new.path);
00388   errsv = errno;
00389   ReleaseTokenFSCall();
00390   if (rc) Return(posix2fsal_error(errsv), errsv, INDEX_FSAL_link);
00391   
00392   
00393   /* add the link in the database */
00394   buffstat.st_nlink++; /* avoid to stat the new file */
00395   status = fsal_internal_posix2posixdb_fileinfo(&buffstat, &info); 
00396   if (FSAL_IS_ERROR(status)) Return(status.major, status.minor, INDEX_FSAL_link);
00397   
00398   if (FSAL_IS_ERROR (status = fsal_internal_posixdb_add_entry( p_context->p_conn, p_link_name, &info, p_dir_handle, &newhandle)))
00399     Return(status.major, status.minor, INDEX_FSAL_link);
00400   
00401   /* optionnaly get attributes */
00402   
00403   if ( p_attributes ) {
00404     TakeTokenFSCall();
00405     rc = lstat(fsalpath_old.path, &buffstat);
00406     errsv = errno;
00407     ReleaseTokenFSCall();
00408     if (rc) {
00409       status.major = posix2fsal_error(errsv);
00410       status.minor = errsv;
00411     } else {
00412       status = posix2fsal_attributes( &buffstat,
00413                                     p_attributes );
00414     }
00415     
00416     /* on error, we set a special bit in the mask. */
00417     if ( FSAL_IS_ERROR( status ) )
00418     {
00419       FSAL_CLEAR_MASK( p_attributes->asked_attributes );
00420       FSAL_SET_MASK( p_attributes->asked_attributes,
00421           FSAL_ATTR_RDATTR_ERR );
00422     }
00423           
00424   }
00425     
00426   /* OK */
00427   Return(ERR_FSAL_NO_ERROR ,0 , INDEX_FSAL_link);
00428   
00429 }

00432 
00440 fsal_status_t FSAL_mknode(
00441     fsal_handle_t             * parentdir_handle,     /* IN */
00442     fsal_name_t               * p_node_name,          /* IN */
00443     fsal_op_context_t         * p_context,            /* IN */
00444     fsal_accessmode_t         accessmode,             /* IN */
00445     fsal_nodetype_t           nodetype,               /* IN */
00446     fsal_dev_t                * dev,                  /* IN */
00447     fsal_handle_t             * p_object_handle,      /* OUT (handle to the created node) */
00448     fsal_attrib_list_t        * node_attributes       /* [ IN/OUT ] */
00449 ){
00450   int rc, errsv;
00451   int setgid_bit = 0;
00452   struct stat buffstat;
00453   fsal_status_t status;
00454   fsal_path_t fsalpath;
00455   fsal_posixdb_fileinfo_t info;
00456   
00457   mode_t unix_mode = 0;
00458   dev_t  unix_dev = 0;
00459   
00460   /* sanity checks.
00461    * note : link_attributes is optional.
00462    */
00463   if ( !parentdir_handle || 
00464        !p_context ||
00465        !p_node_name )
00466     Return(ERR_FSAL_FAULT ,0 , INDEX_FSAL_mknode);
00467   
00468   unix_mode = fsal2unix_mode( accessmode );
00469   
00470   /* Apply umask */
00471   unix_mode = unix_mode & ~global_fs_info.umask ;
00472   
00473   switch( nodetype )
00474   {
00475     case FSAL_TYPE_BLK:
00476         if ( !dev ) Return(ERR_FSAL_FAULT ,0 , INDEX_FSAL_mknode);
00477         unix_mode |= S_IFBLK;
00478         unix_dev = (dev->major << 8 ) | (dev->minor & 0xFF );
00479         break;
00480         
00481     case FSAL_TYPE_CHR:
00482         if ( !dev ) Return(ERR_FSAL_FAULT ,0 , INDEX_FSAL_mknode);
00483         unix_mode |= S_IFCHR;
00484         unix_dev = (dev->major << 8 ) | (dev->minor & 0xFF );
00485         break;
00486         
00487     case FSAL_TYPE_SOCK:
00488         unix_mode |= S_IFSOCK;
00489         break;
00490       
00491     case FSAL_TYPE_FIFO:
00492         unix_mode |= S_IFIFO;
00493         break;
00494         
00495     default:
00496       DisplayLogJdLevel( fsal_log, NIV_MAJOR, "Invalid node type in FSAL_mknode: %d", nodetype );
00497       Return(ERR_FSAL_INVAL, 0, INDEX_FSAL_mknode);        
00498   }
00499   
00500   
00501   /* build the destination path */
00502   status = fsal_internal_getPathFromHandle(p_context, parentdir_handle, 1, &fsalpath, &buffstat);
00503   if (FSAL_IS_ERROR(status)) Return(status.major, status.minor, INDEX_FSAL_mknode);
00504   
00505   /* Check the user can write in the directory, and check weither the setgid bit on the directory */
00506   if (buffstat.st_mode & S_ISGID) setgid_bit = 1;
00507 
00508   status = fsal_internal_testAccess( p_context, FSAL_W_OK | FSAL_X_OK, &buffstat, NULL);
00509   if (FSAL_IS_ERROR(status)) Return(status.major,status.minor,INDEX_FSAL_mknode);
00510   
00511   status = fsal_internal_appendFSALNameToFSALPath(&fsalpath, p_node_name);
00512   if (FSAL_IS_ERROR(status)) Return(status.major, status.minor, INDEX_FSAL_mknode);
00513     
00514   /* creates the node, then stats it */
00515   TakeTokenFSCall();
00516   
00517   rc = mknod(fsalpath.path, unix_mode, unix_dev);
00518   if (!rc) rc = lstat(fsalpath.path, &buffstat);
00519   errsv = errno;
00520   
00521   ReleaseTokenFSCall();
00522   
00523   if ( rc ) Return(posix2fsal_error(errsv), errsv, INDEX_FSAL_mknode);
00524   
00525   
00526   /* add the object to the database */
00527   if (FSAL_IS_ERROR( status = fsal_internal_posix2posixdb_fileinfo(&buffstat, &info) ) )
00528     Return( status.major, status.minor, INDEX_FSAL_mknode);
00529   
00530   if (FSAL_IS_ERROR (status = fsal_internal_posixdb_add_entry( p_context->p_conn, p_node_name, &info, parentdir_handle, p_object_handle)))
00531     Return( status.major, status.minor, INDEX_FSAL_mknode);
00532   
00533   /* the node has been created */
00534   /* chown the file to the current user/group */
00535 
00536   if (p_context->credential.user != geteuid())
00537   {
00538     TakeTokenFSCall();
00539     
00540     /* if the setgid_bit was set on the parent directory, do not change the group of the created file, because it's already the parentdir's group */
00541     rc = lchown( fsalpath.path, p_context->credential.user, setgid_bit ? -1 : (int) p_context->credential.group );
00542     errsv = errno;
00543     
00544     ReleaseTokenFSCall();
00545     
00546     if ( rc ) Return(posix2fsal_error(errsv), errsv, INDEX_FSAL_mknode);
00547     
00548     buffstat.st_uid = p_context->credential.user;
00549     buffstat.st_gid = p_context->credential.group;
00550   }
00551   
00552   /* Fills the attributes if needed */
00553   if ( node_attributes )
00554   {
00555       
00556       status = posix2fsal_attributes( &buffstat,
00557                                       node_attributes );
00558       
00559       /* on error, we set a special bit in the mask. */        
00560             
00561       if ( FSAL_IS_ERROR( status ) )
00562       {
00563         FSAL_CLEAR_MASK( node_attributes->asked_attributes );
00564         FSAL_SET_MASK( node_attributes->asked_attributes,
00565             FSAL_ATTR_RDATTR_ERR );
00566       }
00567             
00568   }
00569   
00570     
00571   /* Finished */
00572   Return(ERR_FSAL_NO_ERROR ,0 , INDEX_FSAL_mknode);
00573 
00574 }
Generated on Tue Mar 31 14:37:21 2009 for File System Abstraction Layer (POSIX) library by  1.5.7.1
